resources.string: Welcome to SmartyPlants The fun and educational way for your kids to learn about common plants. Teaches them which to stay away from.
A usually climbing plant that has leaves with three leaflets and can cause an itchy painful rash when touched

When this oil touches your skin, it often causes an itchy, blistering rash. Make a paste of baking soda. This common household item will work to draw out the poisons in the skin and sooth the rash once it has already formed

string-array.name: Questions
string-array.item: What is true about Poison ivy?
Dead Poison ivy is no longer toxic
How do you stop the spread of poison ivy?
wash off the surface with water or rubbing alcohol.
wash off the surface with water or rubbing alcohol.
How do you get a rash?
What is the rash causing agent called?
What is false about Poison Ivy?
It changes colors depending on the season
It can grow as a bush or vine
It sometimes has white berries on it
How long does a rash USUALLY last?

resources.string: Hyacinthus grows from bulbs, each producing around four to six linear leaves and one to three spikes or racemes of flowers.
The leaves are divided into three (rarely 5, 7, or 9) leaflets with scalloped, toothed, or lobed edges.
The flowers lack petals and have four (rarely five) petaloid sepals, tubular at the base with free lobes at the apex.
The flowers are generally white or yellow (also orange or pink in garden varieties), with either uniform or contrasting coloured tepals and corona.
This quiz contains 10 multiple choice questions, 60% and higher is passing
